intro: Rhodiola saxicola, commonly known as the rock rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and fleshy, often blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Rhodiola saxicola is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal medicine.
